epiviz 0.0.0.9002

    Line_chart

    line_chart_plotly.Rd

    The chart function has 3 mandatory arguments to plot, with additional arguments as described further below:

    line_chart_plotly(
  df,
  x,
  y,
  grouping_col,
  plot_mode = "lines",
  color_theme = c("skyblue", "lightgreen", "lightcoral", "grey", "gold", "plum", "tan"),
  y_label = "",
  yaxis_label_angle = 0,
  y_rangemode = "tozero",
  y_min_limit = NULL,
  y_max_limit = NULL,
  y_as_percent = FALSE,
  x_label = "",
  x_axis_reverse = FALSE,
  xaxis_label_angle = 90,
  lower_limit = NULL,
  upper_limit = NULL,
  hover_text = NULL,
  legend_orientation = "h",
  legend_x = 0.5,
  legend_y = -0.35,
  show_legend = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    df

    name of the dataframe plotting, and are mandatory.

    x

    names of the x axis variable of the plot from the df and are mandatory.

    y

    names of the y axis variable of the plot from the df and are mandatory.

    grouping_col

    names of the grouping_col variable of the plot from the df

    plot_mode

    default is "line" use "line+marker" if needed

    color_theme

    is array of colours

    y_label

    y axis title default is nothing , fill in needed

    yaxis_label_angle

    default is 0, can set to other eg:-45,

    y_rangemode

    set to "tozero",

    y_min_limit

    set to the min of the y value, default is null

    y_max_limit

    set to the max of the y value, default is null

    y_as_percent

    default is FALSE, Only TRUE when need y as percentage

    x_label

    xaxis title default is "", add the parameter if needed

    x_axis_reverse

    default is False, only TRUE when you want to reverse the xaxis

    xaxis_label_angle

    xaxis angle , for eg: 90,45, -45.

    lower_limit

    default is NULL,assign the column if it exist in the dataframe otherwise omit

    upper_limit

    default is NULL,assign the column if it exist in the dataframe otherwise omit

    hover_text

    default NULL, give the info on values of x and y axis how fill if if needed.it could be designed as needed for eg:paste("%x|%Y-%m-%d","
    count:%y")#'

    legend_orientation

    default = 'h' , change to 'v' if needed

    legend_x

    default = 0.5, changed when needed depending on the legendpostion.

    legend_y

    default = -0.35, changed when needed depending on the legendpostion.

    show_legend

    boolean, defaults to true,

    Value

    a plotly plot object

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
line_chart_plotly(df= df, x = date, y = count,grouping_col = character)
}
if (FALSE) {
line_chart_plotly(df= df, x = date, y = count,grouping_col = character,
hover_text = hover_template(paste("%{x|%Y-%m-%d}","<br>count:%{y}<extra></extra>")),
y_label = "count/rate", x_label = "date",xaxis_label_angle  = -45/90/45,
yaxis_label_angle  = 0(default),x_axis_reverse= default(FALSE),y_rangemode = "tozero",
plot_mode = "lines"/"lines+markers",legend_orientation = 'h'/'v',
legend_x =0.5, legend_y = -0.35,show_legend = FALSE,
lower_limit = "lower_error", upper_limit = "upper_error")
# if df has lower and upper limit otherwise can omit it.
}


if (FALSE) {
line_chart_plotly(df= df, x = year(as.factor), y = rate,grouping_col = character,
hover_text = "%{x} year, %{y} rate<br>",
y_label = "count/rate", x_label = "date",xaxis_label_angle  = -45/90/45,
yaxis_label_angle  = 0(default),x_axis_reverse= default(FALSE),y_rangemode = "tozero",
plot_mode = "lines"/"lines+markers",legend_orientation = 'h'/'v',
legend_x =0.5, legend_y = -0.35,show_legend = FALSE,
lower_limit = "lower_error", upper_limit = "upper_error")
# if df has lower and upper limit #' otherwise can omit it.
}
